mdRecord.dcterms:title: Voice function analyzer
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: F-J Electronics Ltd. [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: plastic (organic material); metal; rubber (material); paper (fiber product) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Aerophone II Voice Function Analyzer (Model 6800), a device jointly developed by the Danish company F-J Electronics Ltd. and Kay Elemetrics, used to measure air flow and air pressure. This type of analyzer was used by voice labs, ENT clinics, and phonetics labs, especially for applications related to speech-language pathology.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by MERCI (Medical Equipment Recovery of Clean Inventory) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus
